definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Two arms strech out naturally, even with one rope connecting two hands.
sentences.chinese: 用一根繩子綁住兩隻手，雙臂依然能夠展開。

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被繩子綁住的婦女赤腳走在街上的畫面激怒了網民。

sentences.english: Xu felt that she had tied Liu down and repeatedly asked him, 'Are you regretful?
sentences.chinese: 徐認爲，她綁住劉下來，反覆問他，你是否有後悔？

sentences.english: Huo Yuanjia went out looking for Wang Zhilan, found that Yuan Hao was tied.
sentences.chinese: 霍元甲外出找王芷蘭時，發現袁浩被人綁住。

sentences.english: But don't let the myths hold you back.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要讓不真實的傳言綁住你的想法。

sentences.english: He ordered his pilots to employ their harpoons and tow cables to ensnare the walkers' legs.
sentences.chinese: 他命令屬下的飛行員用魚叉和拖纜綁住步行機的長腿。

sentences.english: We are tied down by fuel.
sentences.chinese: 我們被燃料死死地綁住了。

sentences.english: Sometimes we get so caught up in our lives that we forget to go out and enjoy the planet.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我們被生活綁住了，忘了走出來享受這個星球。

sentences.english: One could say, the wife and kids tie him down.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能會說，妻子和孩子綁住了他。

sentences.english: The only reasonable explanation is long-term bondage .
sentences.chinese: 唯一適合的解釋是她曾被長時間綁住。

sentences.english: He tied ropes around it and tried to drag it.
sentences.chinese: 他又試着用繩子綁住金子想拖着走。

sentences.english: Ye Lingqing had to tie him first.
Tided myself to a man who was terrified of being tied down.
sentences.chinese: 將自己綁在一個特別害怕被綁住的男人身上。

sentences.english: The horse has been hobbled so that he can not run away.
sentences.chinese: 那馬的腳被綁住了，所以它無法逃走。

sentences.english: I got off and immediately tied one of his front legs up .
sentences.chinese: 我火大了，乾脆直接立刻用繩子綁住它的一隻前腳。

definition: to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
